The Program


Friday, 6 December

Digital Humanities Center
Barnard College, New York City

  • Welcome and Opening Remarks
    Kaiama L. Glover
    1:30PM
  • Decolonial Joy: Theorizing from Valor y Cambio
    Frances Négron-Mutaner
    1:45PM-2:30PM
  • DH Activism
    Tao Leigh Goffe, Catherine Benoît, Upasana Bhattacharjee, Ranjani Srinivasan, Angelique V. Nixon
    11AM-12:15PM
  • Digital Caribbean Pedagogies
    Isis Semaj-Hall, Robin Brooks, Benjamin Branch, Tzarina T. Prater
    1:45-3PM
  • Digitizing Revolution in the Circum-Caribbean
    Laurie Taylor, Leah Rosenberg, Bryan Wagner, Amalia S. Levi, Roopika Risam
    3:15-4:30PM
  • Workshop on Digital Decolonization
    Elizabeth Maddock Dillon, Alanna Prince
    4:45-6:10PM
  • Telling Histories of the Early Americas: Preservation, Big Data, and the Digital
    Chelsea Stieber, Marlene L. Daut, Elizabeth Losh, Elizabeth Maddock Dillon
    9:30-10:30AM
  • Digital Temporalities
    Gary Wilder, Jarrel De Matas, Jonathan Felix, Bryan Wagner
    10:45-12:00PM
  • Digital Editions
    Kwynn Johnson, Julie Chun Kim, Kimberly Takahata, Lizabel Mónica, Katerina Gonzalez Seligmann, Agyei Archer, Tao Leigh Goffe
    12:15-1:30PM
  • Voicing Online Community
    Miari Taina Stephens, Leslie Kay Jones, Tzarina T. Prater, Angelique V. Nixon, Isis Semaj-Hall
    3-4:15PM
  • The 'Big' Questions
    Halcyon M. Lawrence, Amanda Zilla, Roopika Risam, Kaiama L. Glover
    4:30-6:00PM
  • Conversations in the Yard
    Di-Andre Caprice Davis (Jamaica), Maksaens Denis (Haiti), Asha Ganpat (T&T/USA), David Gumbs (Saint-Martin), Rodell Warner (T&T)
    8:00PM
